Savory Snack: Papdi recipe Sservings: approximately 100 papdi's Duration: 40 mins Papdi is a savory snack which is a main ingredient to make finger licking chaats recipes from North India, India ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³ This recipe mainly contains all purpose flour which makes crispy and crunchy papdi, as you all know there are enumber of dishes can be prepared from maida / all purpose flour. I prepared all papdi's in 40-50 minutes if anyone could help you in this work at home you can easily finish off in less than 40 mins ğŸ˜Š I hope you could get company to make crunchy papdi. By using papdi you can make papdi chaat, Dahi papdi chaat, Sev puri and also you can add crushed chunks of papdi in Bhel Puri.. so many dishes could prepare from one main dish that is "Papdi" â˜ºï¸Â Soon, I will share chaat recipes with papdi. Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • All purpose flour - 320 gms
  • Carom seeds - 1/2 tsp
  • Salt - 1/2 tsp
  • Butter - melted - 1 tb sp
  • Water - 140 ml
  • Oil - To deep fry
Procedure: Dough:
  • In a large mixing bowl add all ingredients
  • Mix well
  • Add sufficient water to make non sticky dough
  • Add water little by little and make perfect dough
  • Rest dough for about 20 mins by covering it with lid / cloth
Making Papdi:
  • Divide dough into small portions
  • Take one part of dough and dust with flour on rolling board
  • Mean while, heat oil to deep fry over medium heat
  • Roll it very thin and press it by using cookie cutter or round shaped mould
  • Take out all pressed papdi and drop them slowly in oil
  • Fry both sides till golden brown
  • Take out them on paper towel and repeat the process till dough completes
  • Store them in an airtight container and use them while making papdi chaat/ Sev puri / Dahi papdi chaat ğŸ™‚
  • Happy Cooking & have a nice day â˜€ï¸
Step by step process shown below with pictures: Note:
  • Adjust salt according to taste
  • Instead of butter you can also add oil / ghee
  • To deep fry papdi use sunflower oil for best results
  • After deep frying , leave them in a big bowl or container, so that they become more crispy, crunchy and then preserve
  • Can preserve upto 3 weeks
  • To remain fresh and crispy always Store them in airtight container
